body_html:
I have a suggestion:

  1. remove the is_external arugment
  2. manually add "-DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY" to every cc_libraries who is part of the _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
    That's sounds more straightforward, because we may have multiple so libraries in the future. We'll add -DTF_COMPILE_AAA to the libraries of libaaa.so , -DTF_COMPILE_BBB to the libraries of libbbb.so, etc.

remove the is_external arugment
manually add "-DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY" to every cc_libraries who is part of the _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
That's sounds more straightforward, because we may have multiple so libraries in the future. We'll add -DTF_COMPILE_AAA to the libraries of libaaa.so , -DTF_COMPILE_BBB to the libraries of libbbb.so, etc.
body:
I have a suggestion:
1. remove the is_external arugment
2. manually add "-DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY" to every cc_libraries who is part of the _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
That's sounds more straightforward, because we may have multiple so libraries in the future. We'll add -DTF_COMPILE_AAA to the libraries of libaaa.so , -DTF_COMPILE_BBB to the libraries of libbbb.so, etc.
